title: Kepler's Equation
text: The formula for Kepler's equation is $$M=E-esin(E)$$. Remember that e will not represent Euler's number and instead will represent eccentricity.
speech: The formula for Kepler's equation is    m is equal to,   e minus esin of   e . Remember that e will not represent Euler's number and instead will represent eccentricity.

title: Set Up the Equation
text: Plug in given information into Kepler's equation to solve for E.
